diagnosis.final_diagnosis: pancreatitis, acute decompensated cirrhosis, progressive hepatocellular carcinoma
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting, along with a history of type 2 diabetes, cirrhosis secondary to hepatitis C, and known hepatocellular carcinoma. Imaging and lab results showed elevated lipase levels indicating pancreatitis, and the RUQ ultrasound revealed features consistent with cirrhosis and liver masses. The symptoms and history led to the diagnosis of the listed conditions.
